concept.title: Late Records and Late Record Handling
concept.shortdesc: You can define a time limit for records to be written to the associated output directory. Any record that arrives past this limit is considered late. This limit is appropriate when you use the time of the record as the time basis.

conbody.p: Hadoop FSlate record handlinglate record handlingHadoop FSFor example, a Hadoop FS destination writes event data to hourly output directories based on the timestamp of the event, and it has a time limit of one day. Any records that arrive more than a day later that the hourly output directory window are considered late.

You can send late records to a late records file, to the pipeline for error handling, or discard the records. When you send records to a late records file, you define a late records directory template.
